section.title: What's this about?
section.para: This document describes the game launcher and some ideas on how the game community can be hold together and thus provide teaming-features and user interaction.

section.title: General overview
section.para: Users play the game with a game client. When client starts, it checkes for updates and then prompts user for login. The User can use the client to configure their preferences and profile, start matches with friends and spectate or review other matches.
To learn more about update mechanism, take a look at chapter "Update mechanism".

section.title: config.ini
section.para: The config.ini file in the game directory contains several configuration values that are mainly used by the launcher. Note that all option keys are case-sensitive but order is not cared for.
If there does not exist any config.ini in the game directory, the game will be redownloaded.

listitem.para: clientnote - the note from most recently downloaded changeset (deleted when displayed)
launchernote - the note from most recently downloaded launcher (deleted when displayed)
releaseDate - the releasedate of the client version (z.B. 2013-12-24 18:32)
releaseName - the human readable release tag
gameJar - the jarfile that will be started when user clicks on "start game"
homepage - the link to eduras homepage

note.para: This chapter contains future ideas that are not yet implemented.

section.title: Authentication
section.para: Players need to authenticate to play the game. To login they need a unique username (account name) and a password. An authentication can be successful only when game client version matches server version.

To authenticate, players need to have an account. Account registration is done either in game client directly or on our website. To register, a valid e-mail address is required to verify your account.

section.title: Profiles
section.para: Each user has a user profile where he can select a profile picture and a displayname for custom games (in tournaments your account name is used always). In your profile you can see your results of recent matches and replay most recent matches.

section.title: Chatting
section.para: Chatting between users is also available while not playing. In order to find partners and group up this is a very useful feature. Chat partners are addressed by their account name.

section.title: Friendlist
section.para: The friendlist allows users to see if their friends are online. You can add or remove friends. Opponent must accept an friend invitation to be your friend.

section.title: Creating a game
section.para: To create a game, the user can use a game creation screen. There he can invite other people and configure some game-specific settings.
